abstracts.cdata!:
This document records the discussion and
            findings of a mission to Gujarat, but is not binding upon
            the Bank until confirmed in writing from Washington. During
            the visit the mission met Messrs. Kamdar (Secretary R&B)
            , A.J. Trivedi (CE Roads), PV Patel (OSD PPM Cell) and the
            SE Road Project Circle Gandhinagar and his staff.

16807247.majtheme: Rural development,Financial and private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Gujarat Rural Roads Project in India.
            The project development objectives were: (1) provide all
            weather roads in rural areas; (2) improve rural road
            construction and maintenance, road planning and road
            maintenance management; (3) development of a higher level of
            road safety and; (4) training of local staff in the
            administration and operation of the road network.
            Performance of Bank during both the project processing and
            implementation phases has been satisfactory. Borrower’s
            performance was satisfactory. The key lessons learned from
            the project were: (a) without political support and project
            ownership, even simple projects can suffer from delays and
            weak implementation, as was the case during the first two
            and a half years of implementation of this project; (b) the
            design and construction quality standards required should be
            clearly and strictly enforced through adequate supervision
            mechanisms to obtain uniform construction quality; (c)
            selection and design of rural roads would be simplified if
            up-to-date accurate topographical maps were available; and
            (d) a steady flow of contracts over a long period, such as
            seven years, enables contractors to receive regular work and
            thereby become established, gain good experience and
            encourages them to mechanize and adopt more modem
            construction techniques.

repnme.cdata!:
India - Gujarat Rural Roads Project (Credit
            1757-IN) : supervision mission December 1991

abstracts.cdata!:
An International Development Association
            (IDA) mission comprising of Messrs. C.S. Nawathe (Highway
            Engineer) visited Gujarat from December 16 through 27 and
            K.N. Venkata Raman from 23 to 25, to carry out supervision
            of the above project. The mission held meetings with the
            Secretary and officials of the roads and buildings
            department, and visited road works in five districts
            included in the project on its return to Delhi, the mission
            held meetings with officials of the department of economic
            affairs, Government of India (GOI), and department of rural
            development. This aide memoire summarizes the mission's
            findings and recommendations as discussed during the wrap-up
            meeting held with officials of the Government of Gujarat and
            subsequent meetings with DEA/DRD. The mission records its
            appreciation for the assistance and warm reception received
            from all concerned, in particular for the arrangements made
            to visit work sites.

            1757-IN) : supervision mission December 1991

16807532.majtheme: Rural development,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
India - Gujarat Rural Roads Project (Credit
            1757-IN) : March 1991 supervision mission

abstracts.cdata!:
This aide-memoire summarizes the
            mission's findings and recommendations as discussed
            during the wrap-up meeting held with officials of the
            Government of Gujarat, and the Departments of Economic
            Affairs (MOF) and of Rural Development (MOA) of the
            Government of India. The mission records its appreciation
            for the assistance and kind reception received from all
            concerned, in particular for the arrangements made to visit
            work sites. Credit 1757-IN for 101 million SDR (US$ 119.6
            million equivalent) was signed on May 12, 1987, and provided
            for: (i) the construction, reconstruction or improvement of
            about 4,040 km of village roads in seven districts of
            Gujarat where the dairy industry predominates; (ii) the
            procurement of road construction equipment to facilitate the
            implementation; (iii) the construction of offices, workshops
            and other project accommodations; (iv) technical assistance
            and engineering services for project management and
            training; and (v) a maintenance planning study and a road
            safety program. The speed of implementation increased
            substantially in the last year, as already reported in
            August 1990. About 310 roads, a total of more than 1,600 km,
            are expected to be completed by the end of March 1991. Close
            monitoring of this progress is carried out in the field and
            at central level by the Rural Roads Cell (RRC) of Roads and
            Buildings Department (R&BD) and contractors are being
            effectively directed to comply with the proper sequencing of
            operations and with the schedules of progress. At the
            present pace 3,600 km of road works could be completed by
            December 1994.

16809965.majtheme: Rural development,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
India - Gujarat Rural Roads Project (Credit
            1757-IN) : January 1990 supervision mission

abstracts.cdata!:
This aide memoire summarizes the
            mission's findings and discussions with Government of
            India (GOI) and Government of Gujarat (GOG) officials.
            However, the conclusions and recommendations recorded here
            are subject to confirmation by the International Development
            Association. The mission wishes to express its appreciation
            of the assistance received from all concerned in the GOG and
            in particular for the arrangements made for visiting many of
            the project sites. The project involves construction,
            reconstruction or improvement of about 4000 kilometers of
            village roads in seven districts of Gujarat where the dairy
            industry predominates. The project is rescheduled to be
            completed in seven years from the time it became effective
            on August 27, 1987. After some initial difficulties, a
            marked improvement in project implementation was recorded in
            March 1989, but this positive trend did not continue. The
            project is now almost two years behind schedule and
            continues to suffer on account of poor funding, inadequate
            equipment, and delays in acquiring land or removing
            encroachments, delayed technical sanctions (TS) and
            administrative (AA) approvals, poor enforcement of contract
            conditions and specifications, inadequate staff and frequent
            staff turnovers. None of the works started has been
            completed in the past 30 months. Road works are only
            partially completed on about 400 km. i.e. less than 10
            percent of the total program length; the project will barely
            reach a 30 percent completion during the project period.

repnme.cdata!:
India - Gujarat Rural Roads Project (Credit
            1757-IN), World Bank supervision mission (August 28 - August
            31, 1989) : aide memoire

abstracts.cdata!:
A World Bank mission comprising C.S.
            Nawathe (Highway Engineer) from the New Delhi office visited
            Gujarat from August 28th through August 31st to supervise
            this project. Due to heavy rains throughout Gujarat
            proceeding and during the period, missions visit to the
            project sites has been cancelled. This aide memoire
            summarizes the mission's findings and discussions with
            the Government of Gujarat officials. The conclusions and
            recommendations recorded here are subject to confirmation by
            bank. The mission wishes to record its appreciation of the
            assistance received from all concerned in Government of
            Gujarat (GOG) and in particular on 30th August, the day of
            'Bharat Band'. A list of officials met is enclosed
            as appendix one.

            Gujarat from February 25 through March 1 to supervise this
            project. This aide memoire summarizes the mission's
            findings and discussions with Government of Gujarat (GoG)
            officials. The conclusions and recommendations recorded
            here, however, are subject to confirmation by the Bank. The
            mission wishes to record its appreciation of the assistance
            received from all concerned in GoG, and in particular for
            the arrangements made for visiting project work sites.

            1757-IN) : World Bank supervision mission (November 17 - 22, 1988)

abstracts.cdata!:
A World Bank mission comprising Messrs.
            R. Mulligan, A. cittati (highway engineers) from
            headquarters, and C.S. Nawathe (highway engineer) from the
            New Delhi Office visited the State of Gujarat from November
            17 through 22 to supervise the subject project. This aide
            memoire summarizes the mission's discussions with
            Government of Gujarat (GOG) officials. The conclusions and
            recommendations recorded here, however, are subject to
            confirmation by the Bank. The mission wishes to record its
            appreciation of the assistance received from all concerned
            in the Government of Gujarat and in particular for the
            arrangements made for visiting many of the project work sites.

16807554.majtheme: Rural development,Financial and private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
A World Bank highway mission comprising
            C.S. Nawathe, Highway Engineer, visited Gujarat from May 13
            through 16, 1988 to review progress of works on the Gujarat
            Rural Roads Project. The mission also made field visits and
            inspected a few road works under progress. This document
            records the results of discussions and findings to the
            mission but is not binding on the Bank until confirmed in
            writing from Washington. The mission wishes to thank Mr.
            A.J. Trivedi, CE Roads and his field staff for the excellent
            arrangements made and courtsies offered during the
            mission's visit.

abstracts.cdata!:
A World Bank highway mission comprising
            Robert Mulligan, highway engineer, visited Gujarat from 14th
            through 16th January to review progress of work on t he
            Gujarat Rural Roads Project. This review, both in PWD
            headquarter s and the field was facilitated by the
            cooperation and countries offered by state PWD officials and
            the mission wishes to place on record its sincere
            appreciation of them.
